result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie J. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
On Counts #2 & #4 each, the Court sentences Mr. Schmidt to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.

The Court STAYS these Sentences and places Mr. Schmidt on Probation for 3 years on each count concurrent

Conditions will become conditions of Extended Supervision if Probation is revoked
Concurrent with: each count

miscConds.notes:
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge 

09-24-2014 The Court orders the defendant reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $301.00

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment or educational programming as approved by the Agent
--to comply with all Family Court Orders regarding child support
--to make all child support payments on time
--to make all payments on arrearages according to the Child Support orders
--to advise Child Support Enforcement Agency of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change
--within business five days of being released from custody or sooner if arrangements can be made, Mr. Schmidt is to report to the Child Support Enforcement Agency: Room 219 of the Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Avenue in Jefferson WI, to complete a case management meeting 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin during the Probation term without the approval of the Court
--no contact with Tina Schmidt 
--All payments toward child support and arrearages are to be paid through:  Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, Box 74200, Milwaukee WI 53274-0200 (not through the Department of Corrections)

Arresting Agency:  Jefferson County Child Support Services

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[Clerk: MK]
case called at 9:40am. 
Defendant Jamie J. Schmidt in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Mr. Schmidt waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for trial. 
Service of the Information admitted; reading waived.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest " entered on Counts #2, #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Schmidt guilty of both counts, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts # 1 & #3.

On Counts #2 & #4 each, the Court sentences Mr. Schmidt to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.
The Court finds that Mr. Schmidt is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Schmidt is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court STAYS these Sentences and places Mr. Schmidt on Probation for 3 years on each count concurrent, with Conditions (which will become conditions of Extended Supervision if Probation is revoked):
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment or educational programming as approved by the Agent
--to comply with all Family Court Orders regarding child support
--to make all child support payments on time
--to make all payments on arrearages according to the Child Support orders
--to advise Child Support Enforcement Agency of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such change
--within business five days of being released from custody or sooner if arrangements can be made, Mr. Schmidt is to report to the Child Support Enforcement Agency: Room 219 of the Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Avenue in Jefferson WI, to complete a case management meeting 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin during the Probation term without the approval of the Court
--no contact with Tina Schmidt 
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge on Count #2
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge on Count #4
--All payments toward child support and arrearages are to be paid through:  Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, Box 74200, Milwaukee WI 53274-0200 (not through the Department of Corrections)

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to Mr. Schmidt.
recess 9:15am.
Consent to Act endorsed by Atty Dahnert
Pre-trial conference on July 30, 2014 at 03:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
The Court appoints Attorney Dahnert as counsel//reimbursement to be ordered at the conclusion of the case
Petition for Court appointed attorney fees

ADDRESS INFO for Jamie J. Schmidt
Current: 2821 W. Court St., Janesville, WI 53548 United States  (Effective: 07-08-2014)
Prior: N8952 County Rd A, Watertown, WI 53094
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 1:30pm. 
Defendant Jamie J. Schmidt in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Constitutional rights are given
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no direct or indirect contact with Tina Schmidt
--to comply with all existing child support orders
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking after Mr. Schmidt's Huber release for today concludes

Mr. Schmidt indicates that he is in the Jefferson County Jail serving a child-support related jail term until October
recess 1:37pm.

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/30/14 at 3:40pm (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial date
